item.title: Upgrade by Fitch Could Pave Way for Greek Bonds to Rejoin Indices
item.description: Commerzbank Research said a one-notch upgrade by Fitch [from BB+/stable outlook] would tip the balance for Greece to rejoin bond indices in January.

item.title: Swiss Re Discloses New Targets Ahead of IFRS Transition
item.description: Swiss Re said for 2024 and under the IFRS method, it aims to reach net profit of more than $3.6 billion, of which the life and health business is expected to contribute $1.5 billion.

item.title: WTI Oil's Two-Month Corrective Decline Starting to Ease, Charts Show
item.description: WTI oil’s two-month corrective decline has begun to ease, based on technical charts, Oanda said, as front-month futures fell 0.2% to below $76.

item.title: DeSantis-Newsom Debate Shows the 2024 Campaign That Could Have Been
item.description: The governors clashed repeatedly on crime, immigration and economic policies, sparring over the respective tax burdens in their states and about the economy under President Biden.

item.title: Nikkei Falls 0.2% in Likely Position Adjustment Before Powell's Speech
item.description: Nikkei Stock Average edged 0.2% lower to close at 33431.51 in possible position adjustment ahead of Fed Chair Powell’s speech later today.

item.title: Israel Resumes Combat Operations in Gaza as Cease-Fire Stalls
item.description: In intense negotiations, Hamas didn’t provide a list of hostage names needed for the cease-fire extension.

item.title: USD/SGD Steady; May Be Weighed by Signs of Easing U.S. Inflation
item.description: USD/SGD was steady but may be weighed by signs of easing U.S. inflation, which would back the case that the Fed’s rate-increase cycle could be over and lead to diminished demand for the greenback.

item.title: Israel Plans to Kill Hamas Leaders Around the World After War
item.description: The nation’s top spy agencies intend to hunt down militants living in Lebanon, Turkey and Qatar.

item.title: The Big Risk Causing Investors to Shun China
item.description: More than $24 billion of foreign money has left mainland China’s stock market since August as geopolitical risks turn people off investing there.

item.title: Nelson Peltz announced a new proxy fight against Disney after the company rebuffed his request to be added to the board.
item.description: Nelson Peltz announced a new proxy fight against Disney after the company rebuffed his request to be added to the board.

item.title: The Senate Judiciary Committee approved subpoenas for two conservative power brokers who have helped provide luxury travel for two Supreme Court justices.
item.description: The Senate Judiciary Committee approved subpoenas for two conservative power brokers who have helped provide luxury travel for two Supreme Court justices.

item.title: Penguin Random House has filed a federal lawsuit seeking to block school book banning in Iowa.
item.description: Penguin Random House has filed a federal lawsuit seeking to block school book banning in Iowa.

item.title: OPEC+ agreed to a significant production cut of an additional 900,000 barrels a day, in a move that will likely keep prices elevated amid the conflict in the Middle East.
item.description: OPEC+ agreed to a significant production cut of an additional 900,000 barrels a day, in a move that will likely keep prices elevated amid the conflict in the Middle East.

item.title: U.S. stocks recorded their best month in more than a year. The Nasdaq, S&P 500 and Dow industrials ended the month up 10.7%, 8.9% and 8.8%, respectively.
item.description: U.S. stocks recorded their best month in more than a year. The Nasdaq, S&P 500 and Dow industrials ended the month up 10.7%, 8.9% and 8.8%, respectively.

item.title: Fauci has agreed to testify in Congress on the U.S. response to the Covid-19 pandemic and the virus's origins in China.
item.description: Fauci has agreed to testify in Congress on the U.S. response to the Covid-19 pandemic and the virus’s origins in China.

item.title: The Biden administration wants to require utilities to replace all lead drinking-water pipes across the U.S. within the next 10 years.
item.description: The Biden administration wants to require utilities to replace all lead drinking-water pipes across the U.S. within the next 10 years.

item.title: The Biden administration's sanctions chief warned Turkish officials that the country is fueling violence across two continents by serving as a financing haven for Hamas and a trade hub for Russia.
item.description: The Biden administration’s sanctions chief warned Turkish officials that the country is fueling violence across two continents by serving as a financing haven for Hamas and a trade hub for Russia.

item.title: A weeklong truce between Israel and Hamas expired early Friday morning, prompting Israel to renew combat operations in Gaza after it said Hamas fired toward Israeli territory.
item.description: A weeklong truce between Israel and Hamas expired early Friday morning, prompting Israel to renew combat operations in Gaza after it said Hamas fired toward Israeli territory.

item.title: Israel's intelligence services are preparing to kill Hamas leaders around the world when the war in the Gaza Strip winds down, setting the stage for a yearslong campaign to hunt down militants responsible for the Oct. 7 massacres.
item.description: Israel’s intelligence services are preparing to kill Hamas leaders around the world when the war in the Gaza Strip winds down, setting the stage for a yearslong campaign to hunt down militants responsible for the Oct. 7 massacres.

item.title: Ford's new labor deal is expected to add $8.8 billion in costs over the roughly four-year contract.
item.description: Ford’s new labor deal is expected to add $8.8 billion in costs over the roughly four-year contract.
